page.title: 10BRIERLEY HILL FLATS
page.content: These tower blocks and maisonettes dominate the skyline of{Brierley Hill. They vary in size but not style. Constructed in the early 1960's when buildings of this type were popular amongst town planners,they've suffered several naturally recognised problems in terms of the physical structure of the building,and the associated social difficulties encountered by residents of such housing, namely vandalism, isolation and a large proportion of elderly and unemployed residents. They cover an area of 12,000 sq.m. including paths,roads,lawns,ramps and steps.There are 789 individual housing units in groups of 8-60. Built as they are along the crest of a ridge which itself rises from 140-150m.,the tallest block rises to about 180m. and can be seen from Malvern, some 80km to the south west.
